content: Sell, buy, exchange wallet.dat from Bitcoin core with a lost passwordFull collection. Private wallets are for sale in one hand.  There is information about passwords to more than half of wallets, there are video reviews of wallets, lost passwords for withdrawal. I can provide any proof, balance guarantee, refund. Sale wallet.datAddress with balance:  1L42VCpdoysXAstA9Ay4Q5V3QsK12grQ7H                                             https://wallet-dat.net/bitcoin-core-wallet-dat/bitcoin-core-wallet-dat-4-02-btc/                                                                                                       Contact https://t.me/wallet_dat_net .Mail admin@wallet-dat.net . wallet-dat.net@protonmail.comhttps://satoshi-box.com/pay/CGqimkHow to check wallet.dat is real or fake?                                                https://wallet-dat.net/how-to-check-wallet-dat-is-real-or-fake/            How to recognize if the wallet.dat file is fake? 1. Use the hex editor and try to find the word “xingfeng” (these are wallets made long ago by craftsmen from China). If you find this word in the code, it’s a fake.2. Then go to the folder “wallets” insert the wallet.dat file (the one you want to check) and run the Bircoin core or Litecoin core and synchronize. If you see “watch-only”, it means that these balances are only for viewing and there are no private keys.They can also change only the wallet address. In this case, old transactions and balances appear. Creates the appearance of a real wallet. If you send any transaction to this address, you won’t see it in your wallet, because the real address is different.3. Also, the transactions in the blockchain and in the wallet must match. You can find addresses for sending and receiving by searching for the word “name” in the hex editor or simply by viewing all transactions in the Bitcoin core or Litecoin core. If the transactions do not match, then the wallet is also fake.4. In old versions of Bitcoin core and Litecoin core wallets, when creating a new address, several addresses are created, all these addresses are stored in the wallet.dat file and the file size changes.5.After introducing BIP32 (HD Wallet) a new address is created for each send and the keys are stored in xpriv, and the wallet.dat file size does not change regardless of the number of addresses. You can also check the address types (segwit or p2pkh) depending on the wallet version they are different.6. In Bitcoin core or Litecoin core enter the following command in the console: “dumpprivkey 1LfV1tSt3KNyHpFJnAzrqsLFdeD2EvU1MK”,e Code 10 (or 13), which means you must enter a passphrase (password).“Error: Please enter the wallet passphrase first with the wallet passphrase. (code -13).”Private key if password is entered or not set“Private key for address 1LfV1tSt3KNyHpFJnAzrqsLFdeD2EvU1MK unknown (code -4)” error, which means that the file is fake.Balance: 22.77 BTC wallet.dat . comments.author: walletdn
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on October 28, 2022, 09:41:44 AMQuote from: saxydev on August 04, 2022, 08:09:10 AMDo not buy these! The chance of recovering the password is too low to be even worth thinking about it!Additionally, there's high possibility the wallet.dat file is fake. Here's detailed explanation from a Bitcoin Core developer/contributor,Quote from: achow101 on April 12, 2019, 02:10:03 AMThe wallet file isn't fake per se, nor are the transactions it shows. What's fake about it is that it doesn't contain the private keys it claims it does.Quote from: yangxin325 on April 12, 2019, 12:44:33 AMThe method of identification is to look at the corresponding version of the wallet code, check the data consistency, time, field, type, structure, It looks very complicated.It actually is not that complicated. You don't need to check any data consistency, time, etc. You don't need to check any of the things you mentioned. You also don't really need to look at the wallet code because the data that they are manipulating doesn't change frequently, if ever. In fact, the specific database fields that are being modified will likely never change in order to maintain backwards compatibility with older wallet versions.What the authors have done here is simply add fields which represent encrypted keys. These fields contain the pubkey and the encrypted private key which will typically just look like random data (because that's the point of encryption). What the authors have done is just create a field that contains the pubkey and random data (or in this case, a string) as the private key.It is impossible for anyone (technical or not, professional or not) to identify that the wallet is "fake" by simply looking at it (besides the fact that common sense tells you its a scam). If done correctly, the supposed encrypted key will be garbage data and its veracity cannot be determined without knowing the decryption key. Of course, if it's just zeroes or some other obvious non-random data, then it can be easily determined. You can inspect the data of a wallet.dat file using BDB 4.6's db_dump tool.Quote from: saxydev on August 04, 2022, 08:09:10 AMDO NOT BUY WALLET.DAT from the internet!Especially when OP seems to sell same wallet.dat file from wallet-dat[dot]com.Hi, no fake, and many private wallets, not on site and not in internet, wallet-dat dot com just reseller, wallet-dat.net first seller in the internet. yes, I agree that some wallets will never be opened, and yes, there are public wallets on the site, but I assure you that nothing is impossible and for a successful opening you need private wallets with at least minimal information
